page.title: 02Sailing Club Dalgety Bay.
page.content: The Sailing Club with its well furnished Club House occupies a large area of the foreshore. Many people are members of the Dalgety Bay Sailing Club. Over the last year membership has risen and many people own their own craft which they moor in the new harbour during the summer months. During the winter months boats are kept in sheds or in owners driveways. The Sailing Club caters for the needs of experienced sailors as well as beginners. Lessons are available for beginners given by qualified instructors. To learn the basic skills of sailing inexperienced sailors normally use a sheltered cove which local sailors call Optimists Bay. The Club also runs many social events throughout the year such as raft races, barbeques and discos.
